author: Robin Means
title: Narwhal Cake Doughnuts [Vegan]
text:
March 2, 2017 LIKE OGP ON FACEBOOK : If you enjoy recipes like this, we highly recommend downloading the Food Monster App, it's available for both Android and iPhone and has free and paid versions. The app is loaded with thousands of allergy-friendly & vegan recipes/cooking tips, has hundreds of search filters and features like bookmarking, meal plans and more! The app shows you how having diet/health/food preferences can be full of delicious abundance rather than restrictions! Need a super-cute dessert to delight your guests (or just yourself)? Make these narwhal doughnuts! Simple vanilla cake doughnuts are decorated with colorful icing and sprinkles, and, of course, the iconic sea unicorn horn! You'll want to grab plenty of snapshots of these cuties before serving them. Narwhal Cake Doughnuts [Vegan] 1/2 cup vegan butter (or substitute any vegetable oil) 1 cup sugar 1 cup vanilla soymilk (or substitute any non-dairy milk) 1/2 tablespoon apple cider vinegar 1/2 tablespoon vanilla extract Vegan egg replacer for two eggs 2 cups unbleached flour 2 cups sifted powdered sugar 1 ounce non-dairy milk (can sub water or juice) 1 tablespoon vanilla extract For the Decoration: 9 sugar cones, for the horn 18 round candies or sprinkles (or 9 round and 18 long sprinkles if you want them to wink at you), for the face 9 curved pink, red, or white sprinkles (you can substitute any mouth-shaped edible decoration), for the mouth Preparation To Make the Doughnuts: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Mix the wet ingredients in a saucepan over low-med heat until the butter melts and sugar dissolves (the wet ingredients are the first 6 in the list). Sift the dry ingredients together in a bowl (2 cups flour, 1 tablespoon baking powder, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon nutmeg). Mix the dry and wet ingredients together just until incorporated (until you no longer see any dry spots). Press the batter into nine ungreased doughnut-shaped moulds. Bake for 15-20 minutes (or until you insert a toothpick and it comes out clean). Remove from oven and place pans on cooling racks. Remove doughnuts from the pans using a flexible silicone spatula, by shimmying the spatula down the sides of the down so far that it curls all the way underneath each doughnut (start this step only when completely cooled). To Make the Icing: Whisk the ingredients using a stand mixer. Divide the icing into two wide shallow bowls with 1/4 of the icing in 1 bowl and the rest in another. Add blue vegan food coloring to the larger amount. Add pink vegan food coloring to the smaller amount. To Assemble: Cut (or eat) the wide part off of nine sugar cones. Choose your facial features, and separate out nine sets of them so they’re ready to place. Dip three doughnut tops into the blue icing and set on a cooling rack or parchment paper. Choose the doughnut that you iced first to decorate. You want the icing to stop dripping before you start decorating, but you also want the icing to still be wet, so work quickly. Place the mouth and eyes. Ice the edge of a sugar cone horn and press lightly until it stays. Pipe the border of the pink icing on part of the top of each doughnut and fill it in. Set aside to harden. 
AUTHOR & RECIPE DETAILS 
Cute, colorful, and Instagram-worthy vegan desserts. I was born and raised a fairy-unicorn in the San Francisco Bay Area to a hippie chef mom and an activist dad. My wings shine brightest when I’m eating chocolate, drinking coffee, petting dogs, making cute food , and attending tea parties.
